message.content:
cs.RO, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.SY, cs.AI. 

The paper proposes a novel visual-inertial SLAM algorithm that optimally fuses IMU measurements and monocular images to provide 3D motion tracking with bounded error. This topic is highly relevant to the field of robotics (cs.RO) as it enables accurate positioning for mobile and wearable sensor systems. The algorithm also involves feature matching (cs.CV) and efficient computation (cs.LG), which are important sub-fields in computer vision and machine learning. The use of Kalman filters and state vectors also suggests a potential fit for the sub-category of control systems (cs.SY). Finally, the paper's focus on optimization and efficiency could also place it in the sub-category of artificial intelligence (cs.AI).
